intro: Gymnodes campestris, commonly known as the field gymnodes, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and roadsides. Gymnodes campestris is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
